[The #1 Best Hospital in DFW | UT Southwestern Medical Center (utswmed.org)](https://utswmed.org/why-utsw/best-hospital/) To learn more about the benefits UT Southwestern offers, visit [https://www.utsouthwestern.edu/employees/hr-resources/](https://www.utsouthwestern.edu/employees/hr-resources/) 1. Provide physical therapy as specified in the physical therapy plan of care, which may include: a. Implementing treatment programs that include therapeutic exercises, gait training and techniques, ADL training, administration of the therapeutic heat and cold, ultrasound, electric current, and goniometric measurement. b. Modify treatment techniques as indicated in the plan of care. c. Obtain copy of plan of care made by PT and provide care exactly as written. 2. Respond to acute changes. 3. Teach patient/caregiver to perform selected treatment procedures. 4. Identify architectural barriers. 5. Demonstrate appropriate written, oral, and non-verbal communication with patients, families, and colleagues. 6. Demonstrates safe, ethical, and legal practice. 7. Notify supervising PT and Clinical Supervisor of any patient's change in condition. 8. Attend case conferences. 9. Inform supervising PT of last scheduled visit one week prior so that PT can schedule to see patient on the last visit. Other Duties: Performs other duties as assigned. Work requires good communication and interpersonal skills. Work requires good working knowledge of equipment and materials used in physical therapy. Work requires incumbent to devote up to 25% of time to personal contacts with patients and their families involving explanation of facts, procedures, and policies relating to problems of recurring nature. Exposure to dust/dirt/fumes, exposure to disease, move and position patients, bending or reaching, driving a vehicle, more than average exposure to variable weather and road conditions, walking, annual physical examination, lifting over 50 pounds, available to work all shifts. This position is security-sensitive and subject to Texas Education Code §51.215, which authorizes UT Southwestern to obtain criminal history record information.
